name: Frequency Shifter
description: This algorithm is based on the Frequency Shifter algorithm from disting EX. It shifts frequency (not pitch), meaning it adds a shift to the frequencies of constituent harmonics rather than multiplying them like a pitch shifter, which preserves harmonic relationships. This creates more 'clangorous' or 'bell-like' sounds. The algorithm includes adjustable parameters for shift amount, multiplier scaling, CV input sensitivity, wet/dry mix, and output gain.
use_cases: Creating metallic or bell-like sounds by breaking harmonic relationships
Generating complex, evolving textures in sound design
Adding a 'ringing' effect to audio signals
Modulating frequencies with CV for dynamic processing
gui_description: The interface includes controls for frequency shift amount (with multiplier scaling), CV input sensitivity, wet/dry mix, and output level. Routing parameters allow selection of input/output buses and stereo width control.

parameters.name: Multiplier
parameters.description: Set a multiplier for the shift amount: x1, x10, x100, or x1000.

parameters.name: Hz/V
parameters.description: Sets the scaling of the shift CV input, in Hz/Volt. One of: 1Hz/V, 10Hz/V, 100Hz/V, or 1kHz/V.

parameters.name: Level
parameters.description: The output gain applied to the effected signal.

parameters.name: Shift_input
parameters.description: The bus to use for the frequency shift CV.

parameters.name: Width
parameters.description: The number of busses to process, starting from the Input. For example, for a stereo signal, set this to 2.

parameters.name: +ve_shift_output
parameters.description: The bus to use for the positive shifted output.

parameters.name: +ve_shift_mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector for the positive shifted output.

parameters.name: -ve_shift_output
parameters.description: The bus to use for the negative shifted output.

parameters.name: -ve_shift_mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector for the negative shifted output.

input_ports.name: Audio Input
input_ports.description: The first audio input bus (default: Bus 1). Supports mono or stereo inputs based on the Width parameter.

input_ports.name: Shift CV
input_ports.description: CV input for frequency shift, scaled by Hz/V parameter. Accepts voltage control signals.

output_ports.name: +ve Shifted Output
output_ports.description: The bus carrying the positively shifted audio signal (default: Bus 13). Mode is selectable via +ve_shift_mode.

output_ports.name: -ve Shifted Output
output_ports.description: The bus carrying the negatively shifted audio signal (default: Bus 0). Mode is selectable via -ve_shift_mode.
